text: On this day in 2007, Rep. Ron Paul of Texas, the Libertarian Party's presidential nominee in 1988, announced his candidacy for the GOP presidential nomination on C-SPAN's "Washington Journal." He ran again in 2012, and his son ran in 2016

text: I don’t understand the Bernie Sanders analogy. Bernie, Hillary and Trump never competed on the same ballot, so he wouldn’t have divided the non-Trump vote the way Gaga might have split the non-Colman vote. Is the voter saying they use preferential balloting for Best Actress?
author: robyoon

text: I’d say it’s more of a bee-plus.
author: robyoon

text:
15 yrs ago today, John Edwards ended his bid for the Dem. presidential nomination. Over the next 4 years, Edwards:
1) was VP nominee
2) ran for president again
3) dropped out again
4) had affair w/ campaign worker
5) fathered campaign worker's child
*not necessarily in that order
author: robyoon

text: There used to be a great Casablanca bar for many years in Cambridge Massachusetts but it’s closed now. It was modeled after Rick’s, and I’m sure they would have let you sing La Marseillaise

text: A @UMich-led team of biologists gets footage of a “the size of a dinner plate” dragging off the body of an opossum. Plus other “rare & disturbing predator-prey interactions” (Though EVERY predator-prey interaction must be disturbing if you’re the prey)

text: Few campaign themes are 100% original, whether intentional or not. “Make America Great Again” was a Reagan slogan in 1980. Warren’s “Best President Money Can’t Buy” has shades of 1998 Gray Davis: “Experience Money Can’t Buy.” Got him elected twice though he was recalled in 2003
author: robyoon

text: GREEN BOOK is the 5th #BestPicture winner in the past 7 years to not also win the Oscar for Best Director. #Oscars
author: robyoon

text: Paul Rudd being very gracious as Emma Stone blocks his view of Olivia Colman's Best Actress acceptance speech. #oscars
author: robyoon

text: This may be my busted Oscar pool talking, but Olivia Colman does not belong in the Best Actress category. Hers was a supporting role in "The Favourite," which had two lead actresses, Emma Stone and Rachel Weisz. This is what happens when studios game the #Oscars
author: robyoon

text: If @RealRonHoward blinks his left eye, he can pretend that the Oscar for #FreeSolo was actually for his Star Wars flick, #Solo (which I enjoyed). #oscars
